page_intro: Through the Human Face Emotion Becomes Visible as Ekman’s Research Reveals the Universal Language of Expression and Truth.

articles.title: Understanding the Facial Action Coding System
articles.subtitle: The universal science of human expression.
articles.main_paragraph_bold: Facial expression is the direct reflection of emotion across all cultures.
articles.paragraph_1: This article explains Paul Ekman’s Facial Action Coding System, which categorises every visible movement of the human face into distinct action units.
articles.paragraph_2: Learning FACS helps decode emotions like joy, anger or fear with precision, linking psychology and biology through expression.
articles.focus: Ekman FACS facial expression psychology emotion recognition science

articles.title: Universal Expressions of Emotion
articles.subtitle: How emotion is recognised across every human culture.
articles.main_paragraph_bold: Despite language and tradition, emotion speaks the same visual language everywhere.
articles.paragraph_1: This article explores Ekman’s cross-cultural research proving that basic emotions are recognised universally from happiness to disgust.
articles.paragraph_2: It shows how evolution shaped the face as a global communication tool of emotional truth.

articles.title: Microexpressions and Emotional Truth
articles.subtitle: Decoding emotion in a fraction of a second.
articles.main_paragraph_bold: Microexpressions reveal hidden emotion faster than words can form.
articles.paragraph_1: This article introduces Ekman’s discovery of microexpressions involuntary facial movements lasting less than a second.
articles.paragraph_2: They reveal suppressed emotion and authenticity, providing insight into the complexity of human communication.
